Package api

Interface game_service

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public interface game_service
extends java.io.Serializable
    This interface represents the main functionality of the game-server, allowing a User the following: 1. construct_a_Game(int type); 2. getInfo(); getGraph(), getAgents(), getPokemon(); // JSON format: 3. locateAgents(); 4. start_game() 5. move(); // move all Agents 6. chooseNextEdge(int agentID, int destNodeID); //main algorithm 7. stop_game() 8. login(long id): (for reporting the results of Ex2)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean addAgent​(int start_node)
      This method allows the user to add & locate the agents, all should be located in order to start a game.
      long chooseNextEdge​(int id, int next_node)
      This method is the main logical functionality, allows the client algorithm to direct each agent to the "next" edge.
      java.lang.String getAgents()
      Returns a JSON string, representing all the Agents.
      java.lang.String getGraph()
      Returns a JSON representation of graph as a JSON String.
      default directed_weighted_graph getJava_Graph_Not_to_be_used()
      Returns an interface to the graph (should NOT be used) for final version - for testing only.
      java.lang.String getPokemons()
      Returns a JSON string, representing all Pokemons (fixed bonus coin).
      boolean isRunning()
      Returns the current status of the game (true: is running, false: NOT running).
      boolean login​(long id)
      Performs a login - so the results of the game will be stored in the data-base after the game, requires Internet connection.
      java.lang.String move()
      moves all the agents along each edge, if the agent is on the node (nothing is done - requires to chooseNextEdge(int id, int next_node)
      long startGame()
      Start a new game
      long stopGame()
      Stops the game, after this method the isRunning() will return false
      long timeToEnd()
      return the number of mili-seconds till the game is over

      • addAgent

        boolean addAgent​(int start_node)
        This method allows the user to add & locate the agents, all should be located in order to start a game.
        Parameters:
        start_node - - the vertex in the graph from which the agent will start.

      • startGame

        long startGame()
        Start a new game
        Returns:
        the time (new Date().getTime()) if a new game was started, else -1.

        Returns the current status of the game (true: is running, false: NOT running).

      • stopGame

        long stopGame()
        Stops the game, after this method the isRunning() will return false
        Returns:

      • chooseNextEdge

        long chooseNextEdge​(int id,
                    int next_node)
        This method is the main logical functionality, allows the client algorithm to direct each agent to the "next" edge.
        Parameters:
        id - - the agent id, as received from the the JSON String
        next_node - - the next edge defined as (src,next_node)
        Returns:
        the time the action was performed (-1 if not performed).

      • timeToEnd

        long timeToEnd()
        return the number of mili-seconds till the game is over
        Returns:

      • move

        java.lang.String move()
        moves all the agents along each edge, if the agent is on the node (nothing is done - requires to chooseNextEdge(int id, int next_node)
        Returns:
        a JSON like String - representing status of all the agents.

      • login

        boolean login​(long id)
        Performs a login - so the results of the game will be stored in the data-base after the game, requires Internet connection. The following data is stored: id, level, number of moves, grade & time.
        Parameters:
        id -
